chatgpt_solution:
First, we simplify each of the terms in the product: \begin{align*}
\left( \frac{4}{x} \right)^{-1} &= \frac{1}{\frac{4}{x}} = \frac{x}{4} \\
\left( \frac{3x^3}{x} \right)^2 &= \left( 3x^2 \right)^2 = 9x^4 \\
\left( \frac{1}{2x} \right)^{-3} &= \frac{1}{\frac{1}{2x}^3} = (2x)^3 = 8x^3
\end{align*}The desired product is equal to $\left( \frac{x}{4} \right) \left( 9x^4 \right) \left( 8x^3 \right) = \frac{x \cdot 9x^4 \cdot 8x^3}{4} = \frac{9 \cdot 8x^{1 + 4 + 3}}{4} = \frac{72x^{8}}{4} = \boxed{18x^8}$.
